intro: Cephaelis tenuis, commonly known as the slender cephaelis, is a flowering plant native to the western Himalayas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas at elevations between 1,500 and 3,000 meters. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some horticultural gardens.
